intro: Bosistoa medicinalis, commonly known as the African sandalwood, is a small evergreen tree native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Burseraceae and is characterized by its aromatic, fragrant wood and leathery leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers followed by round, woody fruits containing several seeds. Its medicinal properties have been traditionally used in local communities for treating various ailments. However, due to overharvesting and habitat loss, it is now considered a vulnerable species.
